recipes.name: Crabmeat au Gratin
instructions: Sauté onion and celery in margarine until tender.
Add flour, then slowly add evaporated milk.
Cook until thickened.
Add salt, cayenne pepper, and egg yolks. Stir well.
Add crabmeat and stir.
Pour into a casserole dish and top with cheese.
Bake at 325°F for 25 minutes.
Serve hot.
notes: One pound of shrimp may also be added. Sauté peeled shrimp with onions and celery until shrimp is nearly done. Follow the remaining instructions as usual.

recipes.name: Crabcakes
instructions: Combine egg, mayo, and seasonings.
Add crabmeat and enough breadcrumbs to absorb excess moisture. Stir carefully to blend. Mixture should be firm to hold together.
Form 6 patties and place on wax-paper, uncovered, for 15 or 20 minutes to dry slightly.
Heat oil in a large skillet and sauté over medium heat until golden brown. Turn and brown on the second side. Serve with sauce.

sauce.name: Sauce for Crabcakes
instructions: Place seeded, deveined pepper sections under the broiler until charred black. Discard skin. Dice pepper small and set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat. Sauté mushrooms, shallots, and thyme for about 2 minutes.
Add wine, vinegar, and stock. Cook over high heat until liquids reduce by half, about 10 minutes.
Add cream and reduce again by half, about 5 minutes.
Over low heat, whisk in the rest of the butter, piece by piece, to make an emulsion.
Strain and season the sauce to taste with lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Fold in diced pepper. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Crab Enchiladas with Cherry Tomato Salsa
instructions: Preheat the oven to 300°F. Wrap the tortillas tightly in foil and bake for 10 to 15 minutes, until heated through.
In a medium skillet, heat the oil. Add the crabmeat and sauté over moderately high heat until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes.
Spoon the crabmeat onto the center of the warm tortilla and sprinkle with the cheese and the spinach.
Roll the tortillas into cylinders and place on a warmed serving plate, seam-side down. Surround with Cherry Tomato Salsa.

salsa.name: Cherry Tomato Salsa
instructions: In a food processor, coarsely chop the tomatoes, turning the machine on and off. Do not puree.
In a medium bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes and their juices with the shallot, garlic, coriander, vinegar, chiles, lime juice, and salt.
Stir well. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside for at least 2 hours to blend the flavors.

recipes.name: Poached Salmon
instructions: Place about a half inch of water in a small, 5-6 inch frypan and cover.
Heat the water to a simmer, then add the salmon fillet.
Cover and poach for four minutes, leaving the center uncooked and juicy.
Remove the salmon, allowing it to cool slightly. Serve as desired.
notes: You can add your preferred seasonings to the water or the salmon.
If there's skin, it usually sticks to the pan and can be easily scraped off under hot water.

recipes.name: Salmon-Broccoli Loaf with Dill and Capers

ingredients.name: Parsley sprigs
ingredients.preparation: loosely packed, washed, and patted dry

instructions: In a food processor fitted with a metal chopping blade, mince the parsley finely with 5-6 pulses. Transfer to a large mixing bowl.
Process the bread 2 slices at a time with two or three 5-second pulses to form crumbs. Add to the bowl.
Mince the broccoli stems finely in the processor using three 5-second bursts, then add to the bowl.
Processor-mince the onion with 3 or 4 pulses and add to the bowl.
Flake the salmon in three batches with 2 pulses each time and add to the mixing bowl.
Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl and mix thoroughly.
Pack the mixture firmly into a well-buttered 9x5x3 inch loaf pan.
Bake in a preheated slow oven (300°F) for about 1 hour and 40 minutes, or until the loaf begins to pull from the sides of the pan and is firm to the touch.
Remove the loaf from the oven and let it stand upright in its pan on a wire rack for 30 minutes.
Carefully loosen the loaf all around with a thin-bladed spatula, then invert gently onto a large serving platter.
notes: This recipe is very moist and velvety. Let it stand at room temperature for 30 minutes before slicing.
The recipe needs no additional salt.

recipes.name: Salmon With Basil Cream Sauce
instructions: Cut the salmon into 6 equal serving pieces, wash, and pat dry on paper towels.
Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear the salmon on each side for about 2 to 3 minutes, keeping the center slightly rare as the fish will continue to cook after being removed from the pan.
Remove the fish from the pan with a slotted spatula and keep warm.
Reduce the heat to low and add the shallots and garlic to the pan.
Sauté, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes.
Add the basil, parsley, wine, cream, lemon juice, pepper, and salt to the pan. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until the mixture is reduced by half.
Taste for seasoning, adding pepper and salt as needed.
To serve, reheat the fish slightly in the sauce and then serve the sauce around the salmon fillets.
notes: The fish can be prepared up to three hours in advance.
Reheat the fish in the sauce over low heat, uncovered, for 10 minutes before serving.
